intro: Anemone flore-minore, commonly known as the lesser anemone, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, with slender stems and basal leaves that are heart-shaped or kidney-shaped. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers with five petals, which bloom in early spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The flowers attract pollinators like bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance in natural habitats.
